alert.note: Alert for Allegan; Kent; Lake; Mason; Muskegon; Newaygo; Oceana; Ottawa (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 05 at 2:14PM EST until January 06 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow through tonight. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph, mainly from Muskegon south. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and west central Michigan. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel will continue to be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility to near zero at times. The hazardous conditions will greatly impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow shower will continue to be heavy at times through the afternoon into the evening. An other area of enhance heavy snow will slowly move south from the Ludington area toward the Muskegon during the overnight hours. This second area of heavy snow may be heavier than what has occurred during the day time today. Winds will gust into the 40 to 50 mph range near the lake shore and up to 40 mph inland into this evening. Occasional whiteouts will occur this afternoon into tonight. Localized heavy lake effect snow and hazardous travel conditions will continue into Thursday and Thursday night for portions of western Lower Michigan.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.

area.areaDesc: Allegan; Kent; Lake; Mason; Muskegon; Newaygo; Oceana; Ottawa
